SX0089/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPB/PARIS/LE BOURGET MODIFICATION AIP FRANCE AD2 LFPB REGARDING SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC FM PARIS - LE BOURGET FURTHER TO PTV VOR AND NDB POY EXTINCTION VALIDITY: 13JUN24- 30OCT24 VOR PTV FM THE 12/29/2022 RPLC BY THE WPT (5LNC) OLZOM, NDB POY FM 15/06/23 RPLC BY WPT OXCEL. RESULTS IN THE MODIFICATION OF THE SB CONVENTIONAL DEP PROC BASED ON THIS AID.TEMPO OPR PROC ARE IMPLEMENTED IN ORDER TO HANDLE THE SB DEP ACFT, WHILE AWAITING THE DESIGN OF NEW RNAV STD INITIAL DEP PROC - ALL SID PTV DEP LFPB ARE REMOVED. - ALL SIDS USING POY DEP FM LE BOURGET ARE AFFECTED BY THE EXTINCTION OF NDB POY. SOME INITIAL PARTS OF SID MONOT AND DORDI DEP FM LFPB ARE NOT AFFECTED AND THEREFORE REMAIN USABLE.THE NEW WP OXCEL REPLACES POY AND MUST BE INPUT IN NAVIGATION SYSTEMS OF AIRPLANES DEPARTING FROM LE BOURGET THAT USE THESE ROUTES. ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5J IN FORCE - SID CONV MONOT 5J NOT USABLE - SID DORDI 5J REMAINS USABLE - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM OR MONOT - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW DEP SID CONV DORDI 5J CMB 3000 FT AMSL, UP TO D 17.1 NM FM MLN, THEN PCD DCT OLZOM OR MONOT COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 07/09 TO OLZOM / MONOT WITH SID LFPB 5M IN FORCE - SID DORDI 5M NOT USABLE - SID MONOT 5M REMAINS USABLE IN ITS INITIAL PART UP TO RADIAL 073 TSU INCLUDED. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI - RADIOCOMMUNICATION FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID MONOT 5M CMB FL 070, THEN INTERCEPT AND FLW THE 073 TSU (MAG 253), THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190 TOWARDS OXCEL, THEN PCD DCT TO OLZOM OR MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP 25 TO OLZOM / MONOT/ DORDI WITH SID LFPB 5C AND 5F IN FORCE - PARTS OF SID MONOT 5C / 5F AND DORDI 5C / 5F ARE NO LONGER USABLE AFT 12 NM FM BT. - THE FLW DEP CLR CONFIRMED BY AD DELIVERY : FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON RADIAL BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG 123 THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE: SQUAWK 7600 FLW THE INITIAL PART OF THE DEP SID CONV MONOT 5C OR 5F CMB 4000 FT AMSL ON BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, PCD DCT OXCEL THEN DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI W WITH SID 5C AND 5F - DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL, THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT MAG TRACK 123, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600 FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5P CMB 4000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB253, INTERCEPT BT 245 RADIAL , THEN AT 12 NM FM BT, TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE ******************************************* DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5J -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB 3000 FT AMSL THEN, ENR TO PB093, INTERCEPT MLN 360 RADIAL, THEN AT 17.1 NM FM MLN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE *************************************************** DEP TO RWY 21 TO OLZOM/ MONOT/ DORDI E WITH SID 5M -DEP CLR TO BE EXP : INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT MAG 190, THEN EXP VECTORING TO OXCEL THEN OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI. - RDO COM FAILURE : SQUAWK 7600. FLW INITIAL DEP AGOPA 5Q CMB FL 070, THEN ENR TO PB093, TURN RIGHT TO INTERCEPT TSU 073 RADIAL, THEN PSG BT 180 RADIAL TURN LEFT DCT OXCEL THEN PCD DCT OLZOM, MONOT OR DORDI COMPLY WITH THE LAST LVL CLEARED BY ATC TIL D 40 NM LOL THEN CONT THE FLT ACCORDING FPL IN FORCE. ********************************************* MODIFICATION TO AD2 LFPB 2.22.3.4 PILOTS MUST APPLY THE FLW PROC : SPECIFY PLN BOX 15 : - FOR DEP TO OLZOM : DCT OLZOM (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL MONOT EXIT DEP : DCT MONOT (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY) - FOR ALL DORDI EXIT DEP : DCT DORDI (WHATEVER THE TKOF RWY)

REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT.'

SX0163/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFPG/PARIS/CHARLES DE GAULLE VALIDITY:16SEP24-02NOV24 RECONFIGURATION WORKS ON AIRCRAFT STATION U10 AND REFURBISHMENT OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A. THIS WORK REQUIRES THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A 24 HOURS PER DAY. PHASE 1: TAXIWAY A BETWEEN STANDS S24 AND S30 24 HOURS PER DAY: AIRCRAFT STANDS CLOSED 24 HOURS PER DAY: U10 S24 TO S30 IMPACT ON OPERATIONS : THE CLOSURE OF A SECTION OF TAXIWAY A BETWEEN AIRCRAFT STANDS S24 TO S30 CREATES A DEAD-END: - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 AND SIERRA STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A IN ITS WESTERN SECTION - ONLY AIRCRAFT OPERATING TERMINAL 1 STANDS CAN ACCESS TAXIWAY A3 - NOTE THAT TAXIWAY A3 IS RESTRICTED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 61M - S23 AIRCRAFT STAND IS LIMITED TO AIRCRAFT WITH A MAXIMUM WINGSPAN OF 36M. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW AND LOCATED NEAR THE WORK ZONE ARE SUBJECT TO SPECIAL PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES: U07: RED PUSH MANDATORY ON TAXIWAY A S23: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING WEST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK HEADING SOUTH ON TAXIWAY A3 ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY A S31: PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING EAST PROHIBITED. PUSH-BACK ON TAXIWAY A HEADING SOUTH ALLOWED FOR DEPARTURE TO TAXIWAY NA1. THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO RED PUSH PROCEDURES ONLY: X03 Y03 Y05 Y08 Z03 Z04 Z05 Z07 Z09 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO THE WEST HEADING PUSH-BACK PROCEDURES ONLY: S06 TO S22 THE AIRCRAFT STANDS LISTED BELOW ARE SUBJECT TO WEST HEADING TOWING PROCEDURES ONLY: S6B S7B S8B S9B

SX0065/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFOB/BEAUVAIS/TILLE VALIDITY: 16MAY24 - 16APR25 INITIAL DEPARTURES FOR RNAV SID AT LFOB SINCE 13 AUG 2020, NEW RNAV INITIAL DEPARTURES ARE AVAILABLE AT LFOB, SUPERSEDING THE EXISTING CONVENTIONAL INITIAL DEPARTURES ON THE RNAV SID OF THIS AD. THE EXISTING RNAV INITIAL DEPARTURE FROM RWY 30 TOWARDS OB601 AND SID EVX-LGL 1T-1W, AND AGOPA-ERIXU-LATRA-OKASI-PILUL 1W, IS NOT AMENDED BUT IS INCLUDED IN THIS AIP SUP TO MAKE THE INFORMATION EASIER TO USE. THE EXISTING RNAV SID ARE NOT AMENDED AFTER THE INITIAL DEPARTURES ENDING AT OB601, OB701 AND OB702. THESE PROCEDURES ARE INTENDED TO EVALUATE THE PRECISION OF THE RNAV TRACKS FOLLOWED. THEY WILL BE INCLUDED IN AIP FRANCE. ********************CONDITION OF USE********************* THESE RNAV INITIAL DEPARTURES MUST BE FLOWN BY ALL ACFT FLYING RNAV SID AT LFOB. THEY CAN BE USED BY ACFT IN RNAV 1 WITH GNSS AND/OR DME/DME SENSORS.

IN CASE OF AN UNAUTHORISED XNG OF THE ACT STOP BAR, FOUR VERY BRIGHT, FLG RED SFC LGT AT THE CAT I HLDG PSN AS WELL AS TWO RED LGT EACH ON BOTH SHOULDERS OF TWY BTN THE CAT I AND CAT II/III HLDG PSN ARE ACT. DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHAT IS NOT MENTIONED IS UNCHANGED. PENDING THE INCLUSION OF THESE CHANGES IN RELEVANT UPCOMING AIRAC AMDT, THE COMPLETE UPDATED DESCRIPTION OF THE WHOLE PROCEDURE IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST TO AD OPR USING ONE OF THE FLW CHANNELS: -EMAIL RST(A)SEAMILANO.EU -PHONE +390274862313 -WEB ADDRESS HTTPS://EXT.EUROCONTROL.INT/AIRPORT(UNDERSCORE)CORNER(UNDERSCORE) PUBLIC/EVENTS(LOWER CASE) SECTION LIMC-MXP:MILANO MALPENSA. MENTIONED CHANGES ARE THE FLW: FREQ 131.880MHZ IS AVAILABLE H24 FOR AD OPR 'SEA' WITH CALLSIGN 'MALPENSA OPERATIONS' (PARAGRAPH 2.1.2 'CALL SIGN AND FREQ') AND SHALL BE USED BY PILOTS OF DEP ACFT, AFTER COMPLETING ALL HANDLING OPERATIONS AND CONFIRMING TOBT CONSISTENCY WITH THE RAMP AGENT, TO REPORT 'READY' SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. MALPENSA OPERATIONS, AFTER CHECKING 'READY' STATUS, WILL ISSUE THE ARDT (ACTUAL READY TIME) AND WILL PROVIDE THE PILOT WITH THE CURRENT TSAT, THEN PILOTS SHALL REQUEST STARTUP CLEARANCE TO TWR DELIVERY OR GROUND FREQ ACCORDING TO OPR HR. FLIGHTS MUST BE 'READY TO MOVE' AT TOBT, HOWEVER, ARDT CAN BE GRANTED BY MALPENSA OPS WITHIN RANGE TOBT PLUS 5 MINUTES (PARAGRAPH 2.1.5 LIMITATIONS/REGULATIONS ON APN' POINT 'A' AND 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT D 'ARDT'). TWR DELIVERY FREQ SHALL BE MONITORED BY PILOTS AFTER INSERTION OF A NEW TOBT (PARAGRAPH 2.2.2 'MILESTONES' POINT E 'ASAT AND AOBT'). FOR NON A-CDM DEP PROC - FAILURE OR SUSPENSION (PARAGRAPH 2.2.6), WHEN READY TO MOVE ACCORDING TO THE EOBT, PILOTS WILL CONTACT MALPENSA OPS, INSTEAD OF RAMP AGENT, SPECIFYING THE STAND AND THE FLIGHT NUMBER. REF AIP AD LIMC AD 2.20

AIRCRAFT WITH RADIO FAILURE MUST OPERATE AS FOLLOWS: DEPARTING AIRCRAFT CONTINUE STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. ARRIVING AIRCRAFT - IF HAS ALREADY RECEIVED TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS, CONTINUES STRICTLY ON THE ASSIGNED TAXI ROUTE, TO THE CLEARENCE LIMIT AND WAIT FOR THE ARRIVAL OF THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND OR, IF HAS BEEN INSTRUCTED PROCEED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF THE FAILURE OCCURS IN FLIGHT OR IN ANY CASE NO TAXIING INSTRUCTIONS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED: - IF IT RECEIVES SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS, VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, IT CLEARS THE LANDING AREA AND WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. - IF IT DOES NOT RECEIVE THESE INSTRUCTIONS VIA LIGHT SIGNALS (FOR EXAMPLE IN THE CASE OF REDUCED VISIBILITY) IT STOPS ON THE RUNWAY, AT THE FIRST AVAILABLE LINK, AND IN ANY CASE BASED ON ANY KNOWN RESTRICTIONS, WAITS FOR THE FOLLOW-ME VHEICLE IN ORDER TO BE GUIDED TO THE PARKING STAND. NOTE: THE INSTRUCTION TO CLEAR THE LANDING AREA, PROVIDED VIA LIGHT SIGNALS, DOES NOT IMPLY CONSTRAINTS ON THE ROUTE TO FOLLOW AND THEREFORE CAN ONLY BE USED WHEN COMPATIBLE WITH THE TRAFFIC SITUATION IN PROGRESS IN THE MANEUVERING AREA REF AIP AD 2 LIPK 1-13

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.
